meanings.sent1: The children would yatter on and on about their favorite toys.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, some people tend to yatter instead of listening.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to yatter loudly just as the phone rang.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would yatter with worries, like a never-ending storm.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rain yattering on the roof was soothing.

meanings.definition: A continuous, rapid, and often high-pitched noise.
meanings.sent1: The yatter of the cicadas filled the summer evening.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was filled with the yatter of excited students.
meanings.sent3: The yatter of the old typewriter brought back memories of simpler times.
meanings.sent4: The yatter of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The yatter of the wind through the trees was like a whispered secret.
